articles.title: Coronavirus lingers in your eyes, study finds - Deseret News
articles.description: A new report finds that coronavirus may stay in the eyes longer than in the mouth or nose
articles.content:
A report published in the journal of Annals of Internal Medicine earlier this month found that the coronavirus lingered in the eyes of Italys first COVID-19 case days after it had cleared from her nose, throat and mouth, Live Science reports.

articles.content: Ana del Valle is an extraordinary 106-year-old: the Andalusian super grandmother has won the battle against two pandemics.She survived the Spanish Flu as a child, and she recovered from the coronavirus last week.
